message.content:
cs.LG, cs.MA, cs.AI, cs.GT, cs.SY

The paper deals with the application of inverse reinforcement learning (IRL) to model the behaviour of agents in a financial environment. This involves learning the reward function of an expert agent from its demonstrations, which can be used to design realistic agent-based simulations. The paper also discusses the use of Markov decision processes (MDPs) to model the interactions of agents in a limit order book (LOB), which is a common financial environment. Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.LG (Machine Learning), followed by cs.MA (Multi-Agent Systems) and cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence). The paper also involves game theory (GT) concepts, which makes cs.GT a likely sub-category. Finally, the paper discusses the use of MDPs to model the LOB dynamics, which falls under the scope of cs.SY (Systems and Control).
